verses.verse: (1 He exhorteth good men to praise God, for that he hath not only created all things, and by his providence governeth the same, but also is faithful in his promises,10 he understandeth man’s heart, and scattereth the counsel of the wicked,16 so that no man can be preserved by any creature or man’s strength: by they, that put their confidence in his mercy, shall be preserved from all adversities.) Rejoice in the Lord, O ye righteous: for it (It is the duty of the godly to set forth the praises of God for his mercy and power showed toward them.) becometh upright men to be thankful.

Praise the Lord with harp: sing unto him with viol and (To sing on instruments, was a part of the ceremonial service of the Temple, which doth no more appertain unto us, than the sacrifices, censings, and lights.) instrument of ten strings.
Sing unto him a new song: sing cheerfully with a loud voice.
For the (That is, counsel or commandment in governing the world.) word of the Lord is righteous, and all his (That is, the effect and execution.) works are faithful.
He (Howsoever the world judgeth of God’s works, yet he doeth all things according to justice and mercy.) loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.
By the word of the Lord were the heavens made, and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.

He (By the creation of the heavens and beautiful ornament with the gathering also of the waters, he setteth forth the power of God, that all creatures might fear him.) gathereth the waters of the sea together as upon an heap, and layeth up the depths in his treasures.
Let all the earth fear the Lord: let all them that dwell in the world, fear him.
For he spake, and it was done: he commanded, and it (Or, was created.) stood.
The Lord breaketh the (No counsel can prevail against God, but he defeateth it, and it shall have evil success.) counsel of the heathen, and bringeth to nought the devices of the people.
The counsel of the Lord shall stand forever, and the thoughts of his heart throughout all ages.
Blessed is that nation, whose (He showeth that all our felicity standeth in this, that the Lord is our God.) God is the Lord: even the people that he hath chosen for his inheritance.
The Lord (He proveth, that all things are governed by God’s providence and not by fortune.) looketh down from heaven, and beholdeth all the children of men.
From the habitation of his dwelling, he beholdeth all them that dwell in the earth.
He (Therefore he knoweth their wicked enterprises.) fashioneth their hearts every one, and understandeth all their works.

The (If kings and the mighty of the world cannot be saved by worldly means, but only by God’s providence, what have others to trust in, that have not like means?) King is not saved by the multitude of an host, neither is the mighty man delivered by great strength.
A horse is a vain help, and shall not deliver any by his great strength.
Behold, (God showeth that toward his of his mercy, which man by no means is able to compass.) the eye of the Lord is upon them that fear him, and upon them that trust in his mercy,
To deliver their souls from death, and to preserve them in famine.
(Thus he speaketh in the name of the whole Church, which only depend on God’s providence.) Our soul waiteth for the Lord: for he is our help and our shield.
Surely our heart shall rejoice in him, because we trusted in his holy Name.
Let thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, as we trusted in thee.
